title: undefined reference to `dos_event_create_osThemeEvent'
body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Trying to build `master` on Fedora

## Steps to reproduce

```
# Install QT5
sudo dnf install qt5-qtbase-devel
# Or you can install everything and brute force it
# sudo dnf install 'qt5-*-devel'

# Install other dev libs
pcsc-lite-devel pcre-devel ssl-devel crypto-devel

# Build time
# PATH change is needed to find `rcc`
PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib64/qt5/bin/ make update QTDIR=/usr/lib64/qt5
PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib64/qt5/bin/ make QTDIR=/usr/lib64/qt5
```

#### Expected behavior

It builds

#### Actual behavior

```
/usr/bin/ld: /home/fryorcraken/src/status-im/status-desktop/vendor/nimqml/src/nimqml/private/status/statusevent.nim:5: undefined reference to `dos_event_create_osThemeEvent'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Error: execution of an external program failed: 'g++  @nim_status_client_linkerArgs.txt'
make: *** [Makefile:476: bin/nim_status_client] Error 1
```

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0b47412889f80d9d971cdd5e19cad158e4fd61fc
- Operating System: `Linux xps-franck 6.3.12-200.fc38.x86_64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Jul  6 04:05:18 UTC 2023 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

Full logs: 
[compilation logs.txt](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/files/12102261/compilation.logs.txt)
